law.catch_line: There is a Board of Trustees of the Trust....

text.section: There is a Board of Trustees of the Trust.

section.section: The Board consists of seven members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

Of the seven members:
four shall represent the investors and have been recommended to the Governor by the investors;
at least one shall have expertise in venture capital financing; and
at least one shall have experience as a small business owner.
Each member shall be a resident of the State.
The Governor shall consider geographic diversity of the State when appointing members of the Board.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2008.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
The Governor may remove a member with or without cause.

text.section: The Governor shall appoint a chair from among the Board members.

section.section: A majority of the members then serving on the Board is a quorum.
A majority vote of the members present at a meeting having a quorum is needed for the Board to act.

text.section:
A member of the Board:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Board; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.

The Board:
shall manage the Trust; and
exercises all of the corporate powers of the Trust.
